revised_title: Horizontal-Vertical Filters in Early Vision and Anomalous Line-Orientation Identification Frequencies
tldr: The authors conducted an experiment to study how early visual processing detects line orientations. They discovered that performance is determined by two classes of orientation-sensitive filters with preferred orientations close to the vertical and horizontal. The precision of orientation estimates is worst near the vertical and horizontal, which contrasts with the classical oblique effect in vision.
